text: chances all right you have your go-to
Italian pasta dish but you know what you
should also have your go-to pan-fried
Asian noodles you need different Asian
condiments which you should have in your
pantry already like Sri Racha and then
once you have all those things laid out
the whole thing will cook in the pan in
10 minutes so I have a lot of scallions
here because it's just scallions are the
lifeblood of this dish they're beautiful
they're just so intensely flavored so we
need a lot of them soy sauce to add the
salty flavor also a little salt you need
an acid so I have rice wine vinegar for
that you could also use lime juice here
you could use cider vinegar or white
wine vinegar and I like the way that
sesame oil just gives you that nutty
flavor
and speaking of a nutty flavor I love to
stir-fry in peanut oil if you don't like
peanut oil you can use any other high
heat oil like safflower is good
grapeseed is good but peanut oil
actually has flavor and I think it
underscores the nuttiness of the sesame
oil so I've got my sliced garlic just
thinly sliced that's what you want to
hear the second thing that garlic hits
the pan you want the sizzle I'm going to
let these guys get really Brown around
the edges because I want a lot of flavor
from them the scallion sauce the reason
I'm doing it in a bowl I'm gonna add
half of it and I'm gonna add the other
half later on in the cooking process and
the reason for that is you get this
sweeter scallion flavor because the
skies have had a chance to soften and to
really absorb the oil and then you get
this pungency green fresh scallion
flavor so if you do it in these two
batches you're gonna get both making the
most out of one ingredient and then once
this starts to wilt my noodles into the
pan I'm making this pretty
straightforward I'm just using the
subscale yinz and ginger basically
pantry staples but if you want to add
all kinds of other vegetables or
different proteins you can the only
thing is to know when to add the
different vegetables and the different
proteins so say that you're using
edamame which I love
or spinach you add those at the end but
say that you wanted to add a shiitake
mushrooms or pieces of chicken or shrimp
you want to add those the first time you
have the scallion mixed
once you add the noodles things like
shrimp and shiitake won't really cook
anymore because the noodles will be
insulating them now I can add the rest
of my scallions Sri Racha fabulous hot
sauce 2 eggs I'm just gonna scramble
them a little bit and I'm gonna throw
them in the pan you could leave these
out if you want but what's nice about
them is that they make this whole thing
a little bit rich and soft and that's it
this is finished I just have to garnish
it garnishing it by the way is just as
important as the rest of it because I'm
gonna add even more flavor right at the
end
I love lime juice on this dish because
you've got a lot of know well ok I'm
just gonna say it it's like a little bit
oily but in a good way you know in that
pan fried noodle oily way that is so
delicious and the lime juice just cuts
that dinner quick delicious chopsticks
fork eat it any way you want
